snippet: First, Egypt opened its border crossing, suggesting a thaw in relations between the Egyptian government and Hamas, and then news emerged that Hamas had begun quiet negotiations with Israel to extend a truce.
abstract: Opening of border between Gaza and Egypt, along with rumors that Hamas has quietly been carrying out negotiations with Israel, underscore extent to which Hamas has been operating independently from Palestinian Authority in governing territory; Hamas' separate actions have raised concerns that it is undermining Palestinian unity, considered necessary by many to gaining statehood.

byline.contributor: Majd Al Waheidi contributed reporting from Gaza City, and Rami Nazzal from Ramallah, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: First, Egypt opened its border crossing, suggesting a thaw in relations between the Egyptian government and Hamas, and then news emerged that Hamas had begun quiet negotiations with Israel to extend a truce.

headline.main: Gaza Welcomes Break From Strife and Reopening of Border With Egypt
headline.print_headline: Gaza Welcomes Break From Strife and Reopening of Egyptian Border
